column5: decided to head out to a local spot i frequent when i have time, in which the last few months i have not had very much time to myself. I didnt get a long window of time before the rain decided to come back so i was out maybe an hour, but a successful hour it was. I started off with a hook, worm and sinker and gave that a shot for about 20 minutes, few small perch nothing worth photographing, soon after i switched my worm to a 3" plastic smelt and began fishing some weeds, tossing into different pockets for about 10 minutes when i felt a "SLAM" so i set the hook and began retreiving and to my surprise i landed and photographed this beast, with my cellular phone, Hope it turns out... till the next time... Bud..
Nice bucket there Bud ,same as me had a very little time frame today  MTP
Right On!  By the way, can you post a picture of the lure, "Plastic Smelt"?
sorry clamp-it, it was a Gulp! 3" Smelt, iff'N i can find it, ill post
WTG BUD!!!!!!!!! Where you been? Was getting worried bout you lately, I know its been a busy summer for you with every body moving and all. Glad to see out in my back yard again!!!
yea Joe, you should take a stroll back there sometime... may actually meet ya
my inlaws live right there in confed and i'm there every weekend, lately, fishing the 3rd pond but have never fished there... might try it this afternoon while in town
